Example, if there are 2 noses \n\t  pictures of the same dog, the first 800x800 and the second 400x400,\n\t  then the spatial information will not match.\n\t> More or less realistic assumption; the noses pictures will keep ratio.\n\t> x and y will mean for vertical and horizontal directions respectively,\n\t  (x->rows direction and y->columns direction)\n\t> nx and ny stands for the number of divisions in vertical and horizontal\t\n\t  axis, respectively.\n\t";

 033: 	"""
 034: 	> Implementation of Ahonen's Enhanced Spatial Histogram, with overlaps.
 035: 	> The window size couldn't be fixed. Example, if there are 2 noses 
 036: 	  pictures of the same dog, the first 800x800 and the second 400x400,
 037: 	  then the spatial information will not match.
 038: 	> More or less realistic assumption; the noses pictures will keep ratio.
 039: 	> x and y will mean for vertical and horizontal directions respectively,
 040: 	  (x->rows direction and y->columns direction)
 041: 	> nx and ny stands for the number of divisions in vertical and horizontal	
 042: 	  axis, respectively.
 043: 	"""
